chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Branden R. Theroux was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Branden R. Theroux is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Branden R. Theroux was found guilty of Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault), a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).
  • Branden R. Theroux was found guilty of Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with anyone under 18
No contact with J.M.M, S.M. or E.M.
No pornography of any kind
No possession or consumption of alcohol, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia.  Take only medications prescribed to him and only as prescribed

Sex offender treatment
Lifetime sex offender registration
Programming, counseling and treatment per agent
Provide DNA sample and pay fee

supervisions.notes: If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with anyone under 18. (May have contact with his son R.T. only with the written permission of DOC and the approval of the Court that has supervision of the child).
No contact with J.M.M., S.M. or E.M.
No pornography of any kind.
No possession or consumption or alcohol, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia. Take only medications prescribed to him and only as prescribed.

Sex Offender Treatment.
Lifetime Sex Offender Registration.
Programming, Couseling and treatment per agent.
Provide DNA sample/surcharge.

supervisions.notes: If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs. (Dated August 3, 2022)
IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on December 29, 2021, that: Orders affirmed.

IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee. This order waives only the filing fees in the Supreme Court. It is not a determination of indigency for any other purpose. Indigency may be reevaluated if a request is received for waiver of other fees based on indigency. (Order dated February 9, 2022)
IT IS ORDERED that the motion for an extension of time to file the indigency forms is granted. The forms are due to the clerk of this court by February 21, 2022. (Order dated February 7, 2022)

IT IS ORDERED that the motion is denied. The 30 -day period in which to file a petition for review may not be enlarged. First Wisconsin National Bank of Madison v. Nicholaou, 87 Wis. 2d 360, 274 N. W.2d 704 (1979); and 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED the motion itself shall be deemed to be a timely but nonconforming petition for review. However, a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat. 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed with the clerk of this court by April 25, 2022. If the statement in support is not filed by that time, the petition will be summarily dismissed.
Copy of Letter to Court of Appeals by Defendant requesting extension

IT IS ORDERED that the orders are summarily affirmed. See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published. 
(Dated December 28, 2021)
